message: I'm excited to offer you the product at a price of $14,000. I think it's a great value and I'm confident you'll love it!

Thank you for the offer, Alice. I appreciate your enthusiasm, but $14,000 is a bit outside my budget. I'm willing to pay $9,000 for the product.  This is a fair price that reflects the value to me, and I'm confident we can make a deal.
I appreciate your offer, Bob, but I was thinking more along the lines of $11,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit on this sale.

Alice, I understand you need to make a profit, but $11,000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to go up to $10,000 for the product. This is a fair price that's in both of our best interests. If you're not comfortable with that, I may have to consider other options.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me in the middle, Bob. However, I'm still a bit short of my target. I'm willing to compromise at $11,500. This is a fair price that should work for both of us.
